body_content.explanation: a vote sent by post, rather than a vote by a person physically attending a polling station, meeting, etc.:
examples: Whether he wins will be decided by counting postal votes in the next few days.
Convicts cannot vote, while unconvicted (remand) prisoners can use a postal vote.

body_content.explanation: a system of voting in which people send their votes by post , rather than voting in person at a polling station:
examples: The first host, to be selected next year by postal vote, may be a city like 1980 Olympic host Moscow.
Following the inquiry there would be a postal vote by individual members for guidance on future policy.
